page.title: 15FAWDON FARM
page.content: Another of the tiny farm steadings is Fawdon.It is a hill farm located at around 500' with hills around which rise to around 1000'.Like similar sized places in the area it consists of a large farm house and workers cottages.The farm is owned by the Duke of Northumberland and is managed by the same family who manage Linhope farms.The youngest son has now taken over the running of the farm and now lives in the farm house.There are three terraced farm cottages for workers though these are now empty with the sole labourer living down the valley.The shepherd lives in a new cottage.One house which belonged to the grand-parents of the present tenant is privately owned.The farm is both sheep and arable.
